studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Revised secondary efficacy endpoint analysis to allow formal statistical testing and updated multiplicity adjustments.
Added exit interviews and clarified electronic patient diary (ePD) training and device distribution.
Introduction of the International Nonproprietary Name (INN) efanesoctocog alfa.

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: To include analysis of Patient Reported Outcomes within the overall statistical testing
To evaluate participantsâ€™ expectations of treatment and perception of treatment impact
Update to align with the statistical analytical plan (SAP)
To give greater flexibility to participants who undergo minor dental surgery outside of the hospital

studyChanges.summary: The international nonproprietary name (INN), efanesoctocog alfa, was added.

studyChanges.afterText: Participants in Arm A must have at least 6 months of study duration in both this study and in observational study 242HA201/OBS16221.
studyChanges.summary: Updated selection criteria for participants included in the intra-patient comparison of ABR.

studyChanges.afterText: 9-item version of the Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire for Medication (TSQM-9)
studyChanges.summary: Clarified the specific version of the TSQM being used and updated the appendix.
Added exit interview assessment, related endpoint, and description section.

studyChanges.afterText: In the case of minor dental surgery, blood samples can be drawn within 3 days prior to the day of surgery.
studyChanges.summary: Added flexibility for blood draw timing for minor dental surgery.
